questions.question: Coral bleaching is evidence of what change?

choices.answer: a decrease in sea level
an increase in water temperature
an increase in dissolved carbon dioxide
a decrease in ocean salinity

questions.question: Rainwater washing away sediment on a hillside is primarily an interaction between which of Earth's spheres?

choices.answer: biosphere and hydrosphere
atmosphere and biosphere
geosphere and atmosphere
hydrosphere and geosphere

questions.question: What is the principle of uniformitarianism?

choices.answer: The past is the key to the present.
the past helps us predict everything that is going to happen in the future.
explains why and how a phenomenon occurs.
the present is the key to the past.

questions.question: What are the primary elements that make up Earth's atmosphere?

choices.answer: nitrogen and oxygen
hydrogen and nitrogen
oxygen and carbon dioxide
carbon dioxide and hydrogen

questions.question: Which statement explains the type of system Earth is?

choices.answer: It is an closed system because energy but not matter flows into & out of it
It is an open system because both matter and energy flow into and out of it
It's a shielded system because its atmosphere reflects materials
It's an isolated system because it is separated in space from other objects

questions.question: Topographic maps show the sizes and shapes of the surface features by displaying what?

choices.answer: soil types
weather and climate
elevation
how the landscape has changed over time

questions.question: The banded iron formation is evidence for which of these statements about Earth 2.6 billion years ago?

choices.answer: The locations of the Earth were much farther north
Green plants were unable to photosynthesize at that time
the atmosphere and oceans contained much less oxygen
Bits of magnetite in the ocean produced Earth's magnetic field

questions.question: What is not part of the biosphere?

choices.answer: fossils
bacteria
aerosols
magma

questions.question: How do Earth systems interact with each other?

choices.answer: Through specific components
Through matter and energy
Through nonspecific components
Through scientific models

questions.question: Which of these events is an example of how the water cycle includes interactions with the biosphere?

choices.answer: Rainwater falls on a grassy slope.
Strong waves wash away sand at a beach
Ocean water evaporates and forms clouds
Sediment on a mountainside is washed away.

questions.question: Why is it important for scientists to study multiple systems on Earth at the same time instead of separately?

choices.answer: They get a better sense of what the boundaries of the system are
They avoid errors because processes are similar in different systems
They can observe how parts of the different system affect each other
They save time by studying similar parts of more than one system

questions.question: Which of these statements correctly describes a benefit of ozone to people?

choices.answer: It clears harmful pollutants from the air.
It enhances the skin's production of vitamin D.
It decreases the chance of developing skin cancer.
It decreases the probability of developing respiratory problems.

questions.question: What do ice core samples in Antarctica reveal about Earth?

choices.answer: variations in the the thickness of atmospheric ozone
the increasing and decreasing cycle of sea level
the rate of surface ice melting due to global warming
changes in the composition of the atmosphere

questions.question: Which statement describes the interaction between sunlight and atmospheric ozone?

choices.answer: Solar energy combines oxygen molecules and ozone molecules
Most of the sun's radiation is reflected by ozone back into space.
The ozone layer expands when it absorbs the sun's infrared radiation.
Ozone molecules break apart when they absorb the suns ultraviolet radiation
